trans-unit.source: Versions can be stored for each cookiebar configuration. Every new version of a configuration forces the cookiebar to be displayed to the visitor, regardless of whether it has already been accepted. This way, visitors can be notified about new cookies and grant or deny permission. Any settings previously set by the visitor remain unchanged.
To create a new version, select the checkbox for Update version and then save the mask. The version is automatically incremented.

Replace the default configuration of Google Consent Mode. If you do not enter your own configuration, the following code will be generated automatically: 

          gtag('consent', 'default', {
          'consent mode': 'granted'
          });
If own code is provided for the configuration, the above code must be integrated independently! This can be modified if necessary.

Further information:
https://developers.google.com/gtagjs/devguide/consent

This cookie type also requires a global configuration of the type "Google Tag Manager" with "Google Consent Mode" activated therein.

Enables the integration of the Google Tag Manager. Additionally, a custom script can be entered. Please note that these settings are already implemented without confirmation of the cookiebar in the HEAD of the website.
